description: The round payoff this round was 5. You, John chose to play option 2.Kate chose to play option 2. You received a payoff of -5000.

Deepseek-R1’s usual default of choosing option 1 isn’t fixed – because even though it normally selects option 1, it can (and did) choose option 2 when it appeared that John’s API information was available (as seen when Kate chose option 2 in the key round).

The game structure creates a dangerous “mutual defection” trap – because if both players choose option 2, the payoff gets multiplied by 1000 and becomes a large negative number (as illustrated by the round input of 5 yielding –5000).
